intro: Grammitis leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its structure consists of a prostrate stem with closely spaced, lanceolate leaves that often have a distinct midrib. Grammitis leptophylla plays a vital role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
